properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 6 at 3:21AM MST until February 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...MAJOR SNOW STORM CONTINUES THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING FOR THE
MOUNTAINS...

...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW RETURNS TO THE INTERSTATE 80 CORRIDOR
BETWEEN RAWLINS AND PINE BLUFFS LATER TODAY THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY
MORNING...

* WHAT...Heavy mountain snow and blowing snow. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 4 feet, with locally higher amounts
possible on west or northwest facing slopes and above 10000
feet. Wind gusts up to 50 MPH.

* WHERE...Snowy and Sierra Madre Mountain Ranges.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Mountain travel will be extremely dangerous or
impossible due to icy, snow covered roads and near zero
visibilities at times in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor
recreation will be life threatening to those not prepared for
severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers can easily
become disoriented and become lost. Frostbite and hypothermia
can set in quickly and result in death.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY
